part.name: Magnetometer
part.description: This instrument measures the changes in the magnetic field of an object.

part.name: Solar Panel
part.description: This instrument absorbs the sun's rays as a source of energy for generating electricity and heating.

part.name: Hull-effect Thruster
part.description: this instrument uses a magnetic field to ionize the propellent and produce thrust.

part.name: Nitrogen Propellant
part.description: This type of propellant is used often in space because it is a fire suppressant.

part.name: Xenon Propellant
part.description: This type of propellant is the most common used for ion propulsion.

part.name: Multispectral Imager
part.description: This device captures images within wavelengths across the electromagnetic spectrum invisible to the human eye.

part.name: Gamma Ray Spectrometer
part.description: This instrument measures the distribution of the intensity of gamma radiation versus the energy of photon.

part.name: Neutron Spectrometer
part.description: This instrument detects neutrons in different energy bands and is used for finding hydrogen.

part.name: X-Band Radio
part.description: This instrument uses microwaves in the range of 8-12 GHz and offer higher data rates and accuracy than other bands.

part.name: Deep Space Optical Communication
part.description: This instrument consists of a flight laser transceiver, ground laser transmitter and ground laser receiver. It is a new technology for increasing bandwidth, and still being tested.

part.name: Multilayer-Insulation
part.description: This is thermal material reduces heat loss by thermal radiation.
